DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Last Patient Visit Change Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of new Kaposi sarcoma lesions since the last study visit.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Last Patient Visit Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
